    4 WebApiError = require('./webapi-error');

    61var HttpManager = {};
    7
    8/* Create restler options from the base request */
    91var _getParametersFromRequest = function(request) {
    10
    1178 var options = {};
    12
    1378 if (request.getQueryParameters()) {
    1453 options.query = request.getQueryParameters();
    15 }
    16
    1778 if (request.getHeaders() &&
    18 request.getHeaders()['Content-Type'] === 'application/json') {
    1920 options.data = JSON.stringify(request.getBodyParameters());
    2058 } else if (request.getBodyParameters()) {
    211 options.data = request.getBodyParameters();
    22 }
    23
    2478 if (request.getHeaders()) {
    2541 options.headers = request.getHeaders();
    26 }
    2778 return options;
    28};
    29
    30/* Create an error object from an error returned from the Web API */
    311var _getErrorObject = function(defaultMessage, err) {
    320 var errorObject;
    330 if (typeof err.error === 'object' && typeof err.error.message === 'string') {
    34 // Web API Error format
    350 errorObject = new WebApiError(err.error.message, err.error.status);
    360 } else if (typeof err.error === 'string') {
    37 // Authorization Error format
    38 /* jshint ignore:start */
    390 errorObject = new WebApiError(err.error + ': ' + err['error_description']);
    40 /* jshint ignore:end */
    41 } else {
    42 // Unexpected format
    430 errorObject = new WebApiError(defaultMessage + ': ' + JSON.stringify(err));
    44 }
    450 return errorObject;
    46};
    47
    48/* Make the request to the Web API */
    491HttpManager._makeRequest = function(method, options, uri, callback) {
    50
    510 method(uri, options)
    52 .on('success', function(data, response) {
    530 callback(null, { 'body' : data, 'headers': response.headers, 'statusCode' : response.statusCode });
    54 })
    55 .on('fail', function(err, response) {
    560 if (err) {
    570 var errorObject = _getErrorObject('Request failed', err);
    580 callback(errorObject);
    59 } else {
    600 callback(new Error('Request failed'));
    61 }
    62 })
    63 .on('error', function(err, response) {
    640 if (err) {
    650 var errorObject = _getErrorObject('Request error', err);
    660 callback(errorObject);
    67 } else {
    680 callback(new Error('Request error'));
    69 }
    70 })
    71 .on('timeout', function(ms) {
    720 callback(new Error('Request timed out (' + ms + ')'));
    73 });
    74};
    75

    811HttpManager.get = function(request, callback) {

    809 /**
    810 * Create a playlist.
    811 * @param {string} userId The playlist's owner's user ID.
    812 * @param {string} playlistName The name of the playlist.
    813 * @param {Object} [options] The possible options, currently only public.
    814 * @param {requestCallback} [callback] Optional callback method to be called instead of the promise.
    815 * @example createPlaylist('thelinmichael', 'My cool playlist!', { public : false }).then(...)
    816 * @returns {Promise|undefined} A promise that if successful, resolves to an object containing information about the
    817 * created playlist. If rejected, it contains an error object. Not returned if a callback is given.
    818 */
    81981 this.createPlaylist = function(userId, playlistName, options, callback) {
    820 // In case someone is using a version where options parameter did not exist.
    8212 var actualCallback;
    8222 if (typeof options === 'function') {
    8231 actualCallback = options;
    824 } else {
    8251 actualCallback = callback;
    826 }
    827
    8282 var actualOptions = { 'name' : playlistName };
    8292 if (typeof options === 'object') {
    8301 Object.keys(options).forEach(function(key) {
    8311 actualOptions[key] = options[key];
    832 });
    833 }
    834
    8352 var request = WebApiRequest.builder()
    836 .withPath('/v1/users/' + userId + '/playlists')
    837 .withHeaders({ 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' })
    838 .withBodyParameters(actualOptions)
    839 .build();
    840
    8412 _addAccessToken(request, this.getAccessToken());
    842
    8432 var promise = _performRequest(HttpManager.post, request);
    844
    8452 if (actualCallback) {
    8462 promise.then(function(data) {
    8472 actualCallback(null, data);
    848 }, function(err) {
    8490 actualCallback(err);
    850 });
    851 } else {
    8520 return promise;
    853 }
    854 };

    952 * @param {string} playlistId The playlist's ID
    953 * @param {string[]} tracks IDs of the tracks to add to the playlist.
    954 * @param {Object} [options] Options, position being the only one.
    955 * @param {requestCallback} [callback] Optional callback method to be called instead of the promise.
    956 * @example addTracksToPlaylist('thelinmichael', '3EsfV6XzCHU8SPNdbnFogK',
    957 '["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh", "spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M"]').then(...)
    958 * @returns {Promise|undefined} A promise that if successful returns an object containing a snapshot_id. If rejected,
    959 * it contains an error object. Not returned if a callback is given.
    960 */
    96181 this.addTracksToPlaylist = function(userId, playlistId, tracks, options, callback) {
    9624 var tracksString;
    9634 if (typeof tracks === 'object') {
    9644 tracksString = tracks.join();
    965 } else {
    9660 tracksString = tracks;
    967 }
    9684 var request = WebApiRequest.builder()
    969 .withPath('/v1/users/' + userId + '/playlists/' + playlistId + '/tracks')
    970 .withHeaders({ 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' })
    971 .withQueryParameters({
    972 uris: tracksString
    973 })
    974 .build();
    975
    9764 _addQueryParameters(request, options);
    9774 _addAccessToken(request, this.getAccessToken());
    978
    9794 var promise = _performRequest(HttpManager.post, request);
    980
    9814 if (callback) {
    9821 promise.then(function(data) {
    9831 callback(null, data);
    984 }, function(err) {
    9850 callback(err);
    986 });
    987 } else {
    9883 return promise;
    989 }
    990 };

    1028 /**
    1029 * Remove tracks from a playlist by position instead of specifying the tracks' URIs.
    1030 * @param {string} userId The playlist's owner's user ID
    1031 * @param {string} playlistId The playlist's ID
    1032 * @param {int[]} positions The positions of the tracks in the playlist that should be removed
    1033 * @param {string} snapshot_id The snapshot ID, or version, of the playlist. Required
    1034 * @param {requestCallback} [callback] Optional callback method to be called instead of the promise.
    1035 * @returns {Promise|undefined} A promise that if successful returns an object containing a snapshot_id. If rejected,
    1036 * it contains an error object. Not returned if a callback is given.
    1037 */
    103881 this.removeTracksFromPlaylistByPosition = function(userId, playlistId, positions, snapshotId, callback) {
    10391 var request = WebApiRequest.builder().
    1040 withPath('/v1/users/' + userId + '/playlists/' + playlistId + '/tracks').
    1041 withHeaders({ 'Content-Type' : 'application/json' }).
    1042 withBodyParameters({
    1043 'positions': positions,
    1044 'snapshot_id' : snapshotId
    1045 }).
    1046 build();
    1047

    1133 /**
    1134 * Request an access token using the Client Credentials flow.
    1135 * Requires that client ID and client secret has been set previous to the call.
    1136 * @param {Object} options Options.
    1137 * @param {requestCallback} [callback] Optional callback method to be called instead of the promise.
    1138 * @returns {Promise|undefined} A promise that if successful, resolves into an object containing the access token,
    1139 * token type and time to expiration. If rejected, it contains an error object. Not returned if a callback is given.
    1140 */
    114181 this.clientCredentialsGrant = function(options, callback) {
    11420 var request = AuthenticationRequest.builder()
    1143 .withPath('/api/token')
    1144 .withBodyParameters({
    1145 'grant_type' : 'client_credentials'
    1146 })
    1147 .withHeaders({
    1148 Authorization : ('Basic ' + new Buffer(this.getClientId() + ':' + this.getClientSecret()).toString('base64'))
    1149 })
    1150 .build();
    1151
    11520 _addBodyParameters(request, options);
    1153
    11540 var promise = _performRequest(HttpManager.post, request);
    1155
    11560 if (callback) {
    11570 promise.then(function(data) {
    11580 callback(null, data);
    1159 }, function(err) {
    11600 callback(err);
    1161 });
    1162 } else {
    11630 return promise;
    1164 }
    1165 };

    1167 /**
    1168 * Request an access token using the Authorization Code flow.
    1169 * Requires that client ID, client secret, and redirect URI has been set previous to the call.
    1170 * @param {string} code The authorization code returned in the callback in the Authorization Code flow.
    1171 * @param {requestCallback} [callback] Optional callback method to be called instead of the promise.
    1172 * @returns {Promise|undefined} A promise that if successful, resolves into an object containing the access token,
    1173 * refresh token, token type and time to expiration. If rejected, it contains an error object.
    1174 * Not returned if a callback is given.
    1175 */
    117681 this.authorizationCodeGrant = function(code, callback) {
    11770 var request = AuthenticationRequest.builder()
    1178 .withPath('/api/token')
    1179 .withBodyParameters({
    1180 'grant_type' : 'authorization_code',
    1181 'redirect_uri' : this.getRedirectURI(),
    1182 'code' : code,
    1183 'client_id' : this.getClientId(),
    1184 'client_secret' : this.getClientSecret()
    1185 })
    1186 .build();
    1187
    11880 var promise = _performRequest(HttpManager.post, request);
    1189
    11900 if (callback) {
    11910 promise.then(function(data) {
    11920 callback(null, data);
    1193 }, function(err) {
    11940 callback(err);
    1195 });
    1196 } else {
    11970 return promise;
    1198 }
    1199 };

    1205 * @returns {Promise|undefined} A promise that if successful, resolves to an object containing the

    120981 this.refreshAccessToken = function(callback) {

    1214 'refresh_token' : this.getRefreshToken()
    1215 })
    1216 .withHeaders({
    1217 Authorization : ('Basic ' + new Buffer(this.getClientId() + ':' + this.getClientSecret()).toString('base64'))
    1218 })
    1219 .build();
    1220
    12211 var promise = _performRequest(HttpManager.post, request);
    1222
    12231 if (callback) {
    12240 promise.then(function(data) {

    1234 /**
    1235 * Retrieve a URL where the user can give the application permissions.
    1236 * @param {string[]} scopes The scopes corresponding to the permissions the application needs.
    1237 * @param {string} state A parameter that you can use to maintain a value between the request and the callback to redirect_uri.It is useful to prevent CSRF exploits.
    1238 * @returns {string} The URL where the user can give application permissions.
    1239 */
    124081 this.createAuthorizeURL = function(scopes, state) {
    12411 var request = AuthenticationRequest.builder()
    1242 .withPath('/authorize')
    1243 .withQueryParameters({
    1244 'client_id' : this.getClientId(),
    1245 'response_type' : 'code',
    1246 'redirect_uri' : this.getRedirectURI(),
    1247 'scope' : scopes.join('%20'),
    1248 'state' : state
    1249 })
    1250 .build();
    1251
    12521 return request.getURL();
    1253 };
